alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Kings (Brooklyn); New York (Manhattan); Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northern Westchester; Putnam; Richmond (Staten Is.); Rockland; Southern Queens; Southern Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 6:18AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Narrow band of heavy rain, pea size hail, and strong windshift will impact portions of western New London, Fairfield, Middlesex, New Haven, Hudson, eastern Passaic, Union, Bergen, Essex, Queens, eastern Putnam, Richmond, Bronx, Kings, Rockland, Westchester, Suffolk, New York (Manhattan) and Nassau Counties through 745 AM EST... At 613 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a north to south oriented narrow band of heavy rain, pea size hail, and a strong windshift near the Hudson River. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph expected. Isolated 60 mph possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could knock down tree limbs and a few trees and powerlines, and will blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hackensack and Bergenfield around 620 AM EST. Tappan and Riverdale around 625 AM EST. Yonkers and East Tremont around 630 AM EST. New Rochelle and White Plains around 635 AM EST. Rye and Harrison around 640 AM EST. Port Chester and Glen Cove around 645 AM EST. Syosset and Oyster Bay around 655 AM EST. Huntington and Woodbury around 700 AM EST. Huntington Station and Northport around 705 AM EST. Commack and Dix Hills around 710 AM EST. Hauppauge and Smithtown around 715 AM EST. Ronkonkoma and Stony Brook around 720 AM EST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this line and may lead to minor localized flooding.
